messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: what's on the reverse?

> of an NBTHK paper.
> >
> > Best regards,
> > Danny
> > >

> information
> > > about the sword that has been given the 'paper'. What do these
> columns
> > > contain? Is there an order from right to left as to what each
> column
> > > contains? I can spend time deciphering but it is easier to know
> what I
> > > am looking for.
> > >
> > > 'The Japanese Sword' website shows everything except the reverse
> side
> > > of the NBTHK paper.
> > >
> > > Thanks for any help you can give me.
> > >
> > > Elliott
> > >
> > >
> > >
> >
>
>
>

Thanks Danny,

This will save me alot of time. I am only concerned with the sword,
not the previous owner.

Thanks again,

Elliott

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] what's on the reverse?
messages.msgSnippet: Hello Elliott. The back of an NBTHK paper records the owner ( or person submitting ) at the time of the shinsa.  The empty columns are there to record new
messages.messageBody:
Hello Elliott.

The back of an NBTHK paper records the owner ( or person submitting ) at the time of the shinsa. The empty columns are there to record new owners. There is no info about the sword on the back of an NBTHK paper.

Best regards,
Danny
>
> From: "Elliott" <elliott@...>
> Date: 2007/05/30 Wed PM 02:59:53 EST
> To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [nihontostudy] what's on the reverse?

> Here is a question that I and others need the answer to.

> On the back of the NBTHK origami, there are columns with information
> about the sword that has been given the 'paper'. What do these columns
> contain? Is there an order from right to left as to what each column
> contains? I can spend time deciphering but it is easier to know what I
> am looking for.
>
> 'The Japanese Sword' website shows everything except the reverse side
> of the NBTHK paper.
>
> Thanks for any help you can give me.
>
> Elliott
>
>
>

messages.subject: what's on the reverse?
messages.msgSnippet: Here is a question that I and others need the answer to. On the back of the NBTHK origami, there are columns with information about the sword that has been
messages.messageBody:
Here is a question that I and others need the answer to.

On the back of the NBTHK origami, there are columns with information
about the sword that has been given the 'paper'. What do these columns
contain? Is there an order from right to left as to what each column
contains? I can spend time deciphering but it is easier to know what I
am looking for.

'The Japanese Sword' website shows everything except the reverse side
of the NBTHK paper.

Thanks for any help you can give me.

Elliott
